intro: Baphia massaiensis subsp. massaiensis, commonly known as the Massai baphia, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is notable for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a significant species in its native environment.
